<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; This header declares the C interface to libLLVMTarget.a, which             &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; implements target information.                                             &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;                                                                            &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; Many exotic languages can interoperate with C code but have a harder time  &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; with C++ due to name mangling. So in addition to C, this interface enables &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; tools written in such languages.                                           &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;                                                                            &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
